decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to control the board and keep up the pressure on the opponent. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, paired with powerful payoff cards such as Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition allow for disruption and removal of opposing threats, while the mana base provides consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and control the board with aggressive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Floodpits Drowner. By combining evasive threats like Mockingbird and Faerie Miscreant with disruptive spells and removal, the deck aims to apply pressure early while also maintaining control of the game. Additionally, utilizing utility lands like Mutavault and Gloomlake Verge helps to support the aggressive strategy while also providing additional advantage in longer games.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing a mix of disruption and creatures to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent. By combining efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize with evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game if left unanswered.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing a mix of disruption, removal, and powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to use cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board early on, while deploying threats like Scrapshooter and Mosswood Dreadknight to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Blade of the Oni to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The main idea of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to utilize aggressive tactics combined with the powerful Arclight Phoenix card to quickly overwhelm your opponent. By using cards like Treasure Cruise, Consider, and Sleight of Hand to draw cards and find your key pieces, you can quickly bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal significant damage. Additionally, cards like Fiery Impulse, Lightning Axe, and Spikefield Hazard help control the board and clear a path for your aggressive creatures to finish off your opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combination of cards, including Greasefang, Okiba Boss, Guardian of New Benalia, Monument to Endurance, and Parhelion II. It aims to create a strong board presence and control the game through disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade to protect its key pieces and ensure its combo can come together successfully. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's strategy and enable powerful plays throughout the game.

The main idea behind this Rakdos Aggro deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault, while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while utilizing powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Blightstep Pathway help provide additional value and flexibility in different situations.

The focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt and pressure the opponent with aggressive plays, utilizing efficient removal spells and hand disruption to control the game. By combining powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse with evasive creatures like Mutavault and Bloodtithe Harvester, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of combat damage and direct damage spells. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress allows for an additional level of disruption, further solidifying the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on setting up a powerful combo involving Lotus Field and multiple untap effects. By ramping up mana quickly and utilizing cards like Hidden Strings and Bala Ged Recovery, the goal is to generate a large amount of mana to cast game-ending spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. The deck also includes tools for card draw and selection to help assemble the combo pieces efficiently. With the right setup, the deck can overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and combo interactions.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while also utilizing burn spells to control the board and deal direct damage. By playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage alongside powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and win the game before they can stabilize. The mana base includes lands that provide flexibility and consistency to ensure the deck can play its threats and answers on curve.

This UW Control deck focuses on card advantage, removal, and board control to out-value opponents. Using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to draw cards and disrupt opponents, along with sweepers like Supreme Verdict and Settle the Wreckage to control the board. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Dovin's Veto and No More Lies to deal with threats. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds consistency to the deck and provides additional value. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes various cheap spells and draw cards to fuel this strategy, while also including some control elements like Lightning Axe and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to be aggressive in casting spells and attacking early with Arclight Phoenix to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to use efficient removal spells and disruption to control the game, while setting up the combo of Greasefang Parhelion. By utilizing cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and cards like Fatal Push and Bloodtithe Harvester for removal, the deck aims to stall the game until it can assemble the combo pieces of Greasefang, Okiba Boss, and Parhelion II to generate massive value and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Skysovereign, Consul Flagship and Overlord of the Balemurk for additional threats and versatility.

The main concept of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Opt, Fiery Impulse, and Treasure Cruise, in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal damage to your opponent. Utilizing cards like Lightning Axe and Picklock Prankster helps to control the board while maintaining pressure. Additionally, cards like Artist's Talent and Profit's Eidetic Memory provide card advantage and further fuel your graveyard. The inclusion of Hall of Storm Giants and Otawara, Soaring City offer alternative win conditions in case the Phoenix plan is disrupted.

The deck is focused on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure on the opponent with efficient and disruptive creatures. By utilizing mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria while disrupting the opponent with Skyclave Apparition and Elite Spellbinder. Collected Company provides additional creature synergy and card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of removal and protection spells to control the board and protect its creatures, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive strategy.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to trigger powerful effects like Mayhem Devil and Witch's Oven. By utilizing cards like Scavenger's Talent and Deadly Dispute, the deck can quickly generate value from sacrificing creatures while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes a mixture of aggressive threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and resilient creatures like Cauldron Familiar to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a combination of sacrifice synergies and efficient threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless assault.
